Coronation Street fans were left in stitches after barman Sean Tully made a super rude joke as he served up the drinks. 
Actor Antony Cotton had viewers screeching with laughter when he served birthday girl Sinead Tinker a cocktail that wasn't just blue in colour. 
As he handed her the special drink on Friday, Sean said: “There you go, I’ve even sugared the rim for you.” 
Landlady Liz McDonald then joined in the fun, adding: “You don’t get an offer like that everyday.” Read More Sean and Liz teamed up on the joke (Photo: ITV) Sean made a special drink for the birthday girl (Photo: ITV) Residents were celebrating Sinead's birthday (Photo: ITV) 
Fans took to Twitter to show their appreciation for the innuendo. 
One wrote: "Line Of The Night: "I've even sugared the rim for you"" 
Another said: "Never thought I'd hear anyone in Coronation Street say..."I've sugared the rim for you" the innuendos are re surfacing again" 
"I've sugared the rim for you I wonder how many #Corrie fans got that one," pondered another fan. It wasn't just blue in colour (Photo: ITV) Actor Antony Cotton praised the writer who gave him the line (Photo: ITV) 
One viewer said: "OMG crying with laughter Sean "there you go, I've even sugared the rim for you!!" 
A number of tweets were directed at Antony, and he passed on praise to writer Julie Jones. 
He wrote: "In answer to the many questions about Friday's @itvcorrie, Sean's line about sugaring the rim, it was penned by the marvellous Julie Jones". Like us on Facebook
